intro: Phaca annua, commonly known as the annual phaca, is an herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly rough texture. Phaca annua is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
